title: 107_hr3285
content: The Act titled "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" authorizes the sharing of grand jury information. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 3. AUTHORITY TO SHARE ELECTRONIC, WIRE, AND ORAL INTERCEPTION INFORMATION. Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to allow sharing of interception information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The amendment allows sharing interception information with state or local law enforcement personnel, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. The amendment allows sharing interception information with state or local law enforcement personnel, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 4. FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION. Section 203(d)(1) of the USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow sharing interception information with state or local law enforcement personnel, under guidelines from the Attorney General. The USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow sharing interception information with state or local law enforcement personnel, under guidelines from the Attorney General. Any chief executive officer or law enforcement personnel who receives information must use it in accordance with the guidelines to protect confidentiality. SEC. 5. DISCLOSURES TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR COUNTERTERRORISM PURPOSES. Section 626(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to allow disclosure of consumer report information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision to assist in official duties. The Fair Credit Reporting Act allows disclosure of consumer report information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision to assist in official duties, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 6. MULTILATERAL COOPERATION AGAINST TERRORISTS. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of states or political subdivisions. The Secretary of State can provide visa and permit records to state law enforcement personnel if deemed necessary, as per an amendment to Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Secretary of State can provide visa and permit records to state law enforcement personnel if necessary, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition. SEC. 8 addresses information obtained from physical searches. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition from physical searches. Section 444(j)(1)(B) of the General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel, including the chief executive officer, for official duties. The General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel for official duties, with guidelines on the use of information received. SEC. 10. INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TERRORISM. Section 408(c)(1)(B) of the National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow for the disclosure of reports, records, and information to law enforcement personnel for official duties. The National Education Statistics Act of 1994 now allows the chief executive officer or law enforcement personnel of a State to receive and use information for official duties, subject to specific guidelines.
